headline: Kalshi Saw $208 Million in March Madness ‘Bets.’ But Don’t Call It Gambling.
summary: New York City-based Kalshi has invited users to “Make $ on March Madness” using its nascent prediction market platform.  Kalshi customers placed $208 million worth of trades during the first two rounds of NCAA tournament games, the company says.  Historically, online sports gambling has been tightly regulated in the 33 states where it’s legal.

headline: Robinhood Markets (NasdaqGS:HOOD) Jumps 22% As Q4 2024 Financials Impress
summary: Robinhood Markets (NasdaqGS:HOOD) recently saw a 22% price increase, potentially driven by several key developments. The company's addition to the FTSE All-World Index in March 2025 possibly boosted investor sentiment, indicating global market recognition. Additionally, Robinhood's strong Q4 2024 financial results, including a significant revenue increase, likely added to investor confidence. The company's active share repurchase program, repurchasing over 5 million shares, might have also...

headline: Barclays Prevails in Two Lawsuits Over $17.7B Securities Overissuance
summary: BCS wins dismissal of two U.S. securities fraud lawsuits linked to overissuance of $17.7B debt over regulatory limits as court perceives no intent of fraud.

headline: Wall Street Lunch: Need For Speed (No Need For Driver)
summary: Maserati MC20 clocks nearly 198 mph at Cape Canaveral. Consumer confidence expectations fall to 12-year low. Massachusetts probing Robinhood over prediction markets.
